thread.title: Bill Cosby allegations surface in attack ad by DA candidate
thread.title_full: Bill Cosby allegations surface in attack ad by DA candidate

title: Bill Cosby allegations surface in attack ad by DA candidate
text:
Updated: 8:39 a.m. Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015 | Posted: 8:39 a.m. Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015 Bill Cosby allegations surface in attack ad by DA candidate FILE - In this Nov. 21, 2014, file photo, comedian Bill Cosby performs at the Maxwell C. King Center for the Performing Arts, in Melbourne, Fla. Cosby is replacing his longtime lawyer in a sex abuse lawsuit filed by a woman claiming she was molested by the comedian in the 1970s when she was 15-years-old. Cosby’s new attorney Christopher Tayback filed a form on Friday, Oct. 16, 2015, reflecting that he was replacing Cosby’s longtime attorney, Martin Singer, on the case. (AP Photo/Phelan M. Ebenhack, File) Sponsored Links The Associated Press NORRISTOWN, Pa. — 
A Pennsylvania candidate for district attorney is citing unproven sex-abuse allegations against comedian Bill Cosby in a TV ad attacking his opponent. 
Democrat Kevin Steele is running to be Montgomery County's top prosecutor. His new ad attacks Republican candidate Bruce Castor, the county's former prosecutor, for not charging Cosby when the allegations first surfaced in 2005. 
Castor calls the ad "predictable craziness from a desperate candidate." 
Castor has said there wasn't enough evidence to prosecute Cosby when a former Temple University employee accused Cosby of drugging and molesting her. 
The current district attorney, Risa Vetri Ferman, has refused to confirm whether her office is reinvestigating the complaint by the alleged victim. 
Cosby has denied wrongdoing, and settled out of court after the alleged victim sued him. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WHIO-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
